intro: Crepidiastrum grandicollum, commonly known as the giant collared bellflower, is a striking member of the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its large, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet, often with a distinctive yellow or green throat. Its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and often covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Crepidiastrum grandicollum thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude cloud forests.
